info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 9:44PM CDT until July 12 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CARSON AND EAST CENTRAL POTTER COUNTIES... At 943 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles north of Washburn, or 13 miles west of Panhandle, moving northeast at 10 mph. Reports of accumulating hail along Highway 136 northeast of Amarillo. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Hail may accumulate on roadways causing hazardous travel. Locations impacted include... Panhandle and Pantex. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
